job.title: Data Analyst
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Management Consulting,Financial Services
job.description:
Overview
Guidehouse is a leading global provider of consulting services to the public and commercial markets with broad capabilities in management, technology, and risk consulting. We help clients address their toughest challenges and navigate significant regulatory pressures with a focus on transformational change, business resiliency, and technology-driven innovation. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and digital services, we create scalable, innovative solutions that prepare our clients for future growth and success. The company has more than 10,000 professionals in over 50 locations globally. Guidehouse is a Veritas Capital portfolio company, led by seasoned professionals with proven and diverse expertise in traditional and emerging technologies, markets, and agenda-setting issues driving national and global economies. For more information, please visit: www.guidehouse.com.
Responsibilities
Data Analyst role will be part of a data analytics team supporting a large Intelligence Community Agency with data process improvement, data management, and creating performance metrics and business intelligence for business optimization. The candidate will be required to analyze large and complex data sets, including a thorough aptitude for conducting quantitative and qualitative analyses. The candidate will coordinate with non-technical users to identify data analytics needs support and use facilitation skills and techniques to elicit requirements from a diverse range of stakeholders.
The candidate should have comfort in working with cross-functional teams to present, analyze, update, and view technical data sets with qualitative and statistical analysis. The candidate must have the ability to translate complex problem sets, metrics and assessments into coherent, communications products.
Assess data and analytics capabilities and identify areas for improvement or opportunities to better align data operations with the business strategy
Implement data management practices and frameworks
Work with geospatial and business operations data to create data visualizations in Tableau or other visualization software
Collaborate with the Government to develop, integrate and continually improve data management processes
Work independently and as a team member on assigned data and/or process improvement projects
Work with data scientists to develop systems and methods for hydrographic product line performance metrics
Compile quality assurance technical reports for customer decision-making
Comply with sprint-schedules and Agile development methodologies
Qualifications
The following qualifications are required to be considered for this role:
An ACTIVE AND CURRENT TOP SECRET/SCI clearance with a COUNTERINTELLIGENCE (CI) polygraph
Bachelor’s Degree
Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in programs and contracts of similar scope, type and complexity
Experience working with databases and reating relationships between disparate data sets for robust analysis
Experience developing and visualizing metrics in dashboards or standalone views
Advanced experience with Tableau and other business intelligence software
Familiarity with the following tools: ArcGIS, Gitlab, Jira
Familiarity operating in an Agile development environment
Knowledge of analytical techniques for descriptive, predictive, and perspective insights
Experience in planning and organizing
Excellent communication and customer skills (both verbal and written)
Proficient in MS Office including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
The Following Skills/knowledge/experience Are Preferred For This Role
Ability to script using Python, SQL, and or R
AWS and other cloud services
Experience working with geographic data
Additional Requirements
The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.
Disclaimer
About Guidehouse
Guidehouse is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.
Guidehouse will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law or ordinance including the Fair Chance Ordinance of Los Angeles and San Francisco.

All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodation.
Guidehouse does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Guidehouse and Guidehouse will not be obligated to pay a placement fee.
Rewards And Benefits
Guidehouse offers a comprehensive, total rewards package that includes competitive compensation and a flexible benefits package that reflects our commitment to creating a diverse and supportive workplace.
Benefits Include
Medical, Rx, Dental & Vision Insurance
Personal and Family Sick Time & Company Paid Holidays
Position may be eligible for a discretionary variable incentive bonus
Parental Leave and Adoption Assistance
401(k) Retirement Plan
Basic Life & Supplemental Life
Health Savings Account, Dental/Vision & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
Tuition Reimbursement, Personal Development & Learning Opportunities
Skills Development & Certifications
Employee Referral Program
Corporate Sponsored Events & Community Outreach
